questions.question: What is .NET MAUI?
options: A. A framework for building Windows desktop apps only
B. A cross-platform framework for building native mobile and desktop apps
C. A framework for building web applications

questions.question: Which programming language is used for .NET MAUI development?
Which platforms are supported by .NET MAUI?
options: A. Android, iOS, macOS, and Windows

questions.question: What does MAUI stand for in .NET MAUI?
What is the primary design pattern used in .NET MAUI applications?
What is XAML in .NET MAUI?
options: A. A language used to define UI layout and appearance
D. A testing library for .NET applications

questions.question: Which file serves as the entry point for a .NET MAUI app?
What does the ContentPage class represent in .NET MAUI?
options: A. A page used to display scrolling lists
B. A page used to render web content
C. A simple page with a single content layout
D. A popup page for modals

questions.question: What is the primary method for navigating between pages in .NET MAUI?
How do you apply styles globally in .NET MAUI?
What is the primary purpose of Shell in .NET MAUI?
options: A. To define themes for the application
B. To simplify navigation and app structure

questions.question: How do you bind data to UI components in .NET MAUI?
Which component is used to create a collection-based UI in .NET MAUI?
How do you handle lifecycle events in .NET MAUI?
options: A. Override lifecycle methods in App.xaml.cs
B. Use event listeners in Program.cs
C. Override lifecycle methods in ContentPage
D. Add lifecycle handlers in MainPage.xaml

questions.question: What does ICommand do in .NET MAUI?
options: B. Manages commands in MVVM architecture
C. Acts as a navigation command

questions.question: Which layout organizes elements in a stack vertically or horizontally?
How do you display an alert dialog in .NET MAUI?
What is Dependency Injection in .NET MAUI used for?
options: B. To register and resolve services in an application
C. To bind data to UI elements

questions.question: Which class is used for platform-specific implementations in .NET MAUI?
How can you handle platform-specific behavior in .NET MAUI?
options: B. Use dependency injection with platform-specific implementations

questions.question: How do you implement custom renderers in .NET MAUI?
options: A. By extending the default controls for a platform
B. By creating a service in App.xaml.cs
C. By using CSS files for styling

questions.question: What is the purpose of OnPlatform in .NET MAUI?
options: A. To switch between development and production environments
B. To specify platform-specific values in XAML
D. To implement animations for mobile platforms

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Effects in .NET MAUI?
options: B. To modify platform-specific properties of UI components
C. To create visual effects for pages

questions.question: What does Hot Reload do in .NET MAUI?
options: A. Restarts the application after changes
B. Updates the application UI in real-time without restarting the app

questions.question: How do you improve performance in a .NET MAUI app?
options: B. Avoid using large images in UI
C. Use CollectionView instead of ListView

questions.question: What is the difference between ListView and CollectionView?
options: A. CollectionView offers better performance and customization

questions.question: How do you use localization in .NET MAUI?
options: A. Add resource files for each language
B. Use CultureInfo to set the app language
C. Bind strings to resource files

questions.question: How can you integrate native platform APIs in .NET MAUI?
options: B. Use platform-specific implementation with dependency injection

questions.question: What is the Handler architecture in .NET MAUI?
options: A. A replacement for custom renderers to manage native control mappings
B. A library for dependency injection
C. A layout for handling touch gestures

questions.question: How do you implement multi-targeting in .NET MAUI?
options: A. Use platform-specific folders in the project
C. Use shared code for common functionality
